intro: Sciadopanax floccosus, commonly known as the white-flowered arrowhead, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and small, white, umbellate flowers. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Sciadopanax floccosus is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
